home.message: We are very aware that New Zealand is a long way for a large number of the people we care about. There is zero pressure to join. With this in mind - we will have a reception in Ghent in Summer ‘24.

schedule.welcome: Welcome to Whangapoua. Join us at 108 Waipapa Place for drinks! BYO booze please.
after: The ceremony will take place at the Whangapoua Reserve, land that Tony (Sam’s Dad) has helped replant with native New Zealand bush. Follow the signs from Waipapa Place.
From there we will head back to Waipapa Place, where the reception and dinner will be taking place immediately after.
schedule.info: Join us for Tony’s Pepperoni’s pizza and margaritas, Waipapa Place

faqs.title: Whangapoua Amenities
details: Whangapoua is a small beach settlement, with only one small general store that sells basic food (decent pies) supplies, baked goods, coffee, limited alcohol, petrol and diesel. We suggest bringing with you enough food and drinks for the weekend (Saturday night and Sunday afternoon is on us) as the closest townships are Coromandel (20 minutes) and Whitianga (approx. 30 minutes).

If you are passing through Thames, PAKn’SAVE is located at 100 Mary Street and opening hours are 8am - 8pm. Liquorland, Liquor King and Thames Liquor Centre are located on Pollen Street. Opening hours vary, all closing by 9.30pm.
Our Welcome Drinks on Friday are BYO
Wine, beer, and Pals will be provided on the day of the wedding alongside some top shelf later in the night. We’ve got you covered on Sunday with margaritas and/or coffee!

faqs.title: Gifts
details: Look, we know a lot of you are traveling a long, long way. That is appreciated, and all we are really after.
With that in mind no gifts are necessary. However, if you wish to give a gift, we will gratefully accept a small contribution towards a honeymoon.

• Lisa-Laura Verhoest
  • SORT CODE: 04-00-04
  • ACCOUNT NUMBER: 19015883
  • BIC: MONZGB2L
  • IBAN: GB62 MONZ 0400 0419 0158 83

faqs.title: Dress Code
details: No shirt, no shoes, no free drinks
Please dress however you feel fabulous.

faqs.title: Kids
details: Kids are welcome at the ceremony and at the pizza party on Sunday. Many of you have a little  addition to the family that needs specific care. We will make a space available for feeds etc.The reception is not likely suitable for kids, but babies on the arm are obviously welcome.

faqs.title: To those traveling from abroad
details: NZeTA is an electronic travel authority for those entering from a visa waiver country. Link below
If you are traveling via the USA you need to apply for an ESTA. Even if you are just transiting through! Link below
For both of these visas, make sure you are using the links above - third party websites exist that can make the process annoying!

faqs.title: Parking / Getting Around
details: As Whangapoua is only a small place, you shouldn’t have to far to travel/ walk between your accommodation and where the reception will be held.

Parking is limited, so would suggest walking if possible or carpooling with others. For those who will be driving, please do not park on the driveway of Waipapa Place. The best locations to park, would either be on the main road, or in the small carpark down the very northern end of the beach, near the ceremony and reception locations.

diet.title: Do you have any dietary requirements?
